result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda B. ADELMANN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Fentanyl, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served on 17 CF 226 to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to use only one doctor to prescribe medications and only one pharmacist to dispense medications unless approved by the agent.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 04-20-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.
RE:  Possess Fentanyl, on 09-14-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess schedule II narcotic.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
